title: ICASSP_2016_11_abs

sentences.text: The problem of blind separation of underdetermined instantaneous mixtures of independent signals is addressed through a method relying on nonstationarity of the original signals .
The signals are assumed to be piecewise stationary with varying variances in different epochs .
In comparison with previous works , in this paper it is assumed that the signals are not i.i.d. in each epoch , but obey a first-order autoregressive model .
This model was shown to be more appropriate for blind separation of natural speech signals .
A separation method is proposed that is nearly statistically efficient -LRB- approaching the corresponding Cramér-Rao lower bound -RRB- , if the separated signals obey the assumed model .
In the case of natural speech signals , the method is shown to have separation accuracy better than the state-of-the-art methods .

Entity-a_separation_method.label: A separation method
Entity-a_separation_method.description: A proposed statistical approach to blind separation of underdetermined instantaneous mixtures of independent signals that is nearly statistically efficient and approaches the Cramér-Rao lower bound, assuming the separated signals obey a first-order autoregressive model.

Entity-the_problem_of_blind_separation.label: The problem of blind separation
Entity-the_problem_of_blind_separation.description: Blindly separating underdetermined instantaneous mixtures of independent signals without prior knowledge or assumptions about the original signals.

Entity-this_paper.label: this paper
Entity-this_paper.description: A research paper that proposes a method for blind separation of underdetermined instantaneous mixtures of independent signals, assuming piecewise stationarity with varying variances and first-order autoregressive models.

Entity-blind_separation.label: blind separation
aliases: blind separation of underdetermined instantaneous mixtures of independent signals
Entity-blind_separation.description: A signal processing technique or algorithm for separating underdetermined instantaneous mixtures of independent signals without prior knowledge of their characteristics.

mentions.local_name: blind separation of underdetermined instantaneous mixtures of independent signals

Entity-blind_separation_of_natural_speec.label: blind separation of natural speech signals
aliases: blind separation of natural speech signals
Entity-blind_separation_of_natural_speec.description: A technique used to separate mixed audio signals without prior knowledge or training, specifically designed for processing and isolating individual voices from a mixture of natural spoken language.

mentions.local_name: blind separation of natural speech signals

Entity-the_problem.label: The problem
Entity-the_problem.description: Blind separation of underdetermined instantaneous mixtures of independent signals

Entity-the_state-of-the-art_method.label: the state-of-the-art methods
Entity-the_state-of-the-art_method.description: The current most advanced and effective techniques for blind separation of natural speech signals.

Entity-the_corresponding_cramr-rao_lower.label: the corresponding Cramér-Rao lower bound
Entity-the_corresponding_cramr-rao_lower.description: The theoretical minimum variance limit that can be achieved by an estimator of separated signals, assuming they obey a first-order autoregressive model.

Entity-if_the_separated_signal_obey_the_.label: if the separated signals obey the assumed model
aliases: if the separated signals obey the assumed model
Entity-if_the_separated_signal_obey_the_.description: The condition under which the proposed separation method approaches its optimal performance, assuming that the separated signals conform to the underlying first-order autoregressive model.

mentions.local_name: if the separated signals obey the assumed model

Entity-a_method_relying_on_nonstationari.label: a method relying on nonstationarity of the original signals
aliases: a method relying on nonstationarity of the original signals
Entity-a_method_relying_on_nonstationari.description: A statistical signal processing technique that exploits the non-stationary properties of the original mixed signals to separate them.

mentions.local_name: a method relying on nonstationarity of the original signals

Entity-instantaneous_mixture.label: instantaneous mixtures
Entity-instantaneous_mixture.description: Underdetermined blends of independent signals, where each signal is assumed to be piecewise stationary with varying variances in different epochs.

Entity-separation_method.label: separation method
Entity-separation_method.description: A mathematical procedure or algorithm used to distinguish and extract individual components from mixed or overlapping signals.

Entity-the_signal_are_not_i.i.d_..label: the signals are not i.i.d.
Entity-the_signal_are_not_i.i.d_..description: The assumption that the original signals do not have independent and identically distributed (i.i.d.) properties in each epoch, but instead follow a first-order autoregressive model.

Entity-the_signal.label: The signals
Entity-the_signal.description: Independent audio signals, specifically natural speech signals, which are assumed to be piecewise stationary with varying variances in different epochs.

Entity-underdetermined_instantaneous_mix.label: underdetermined instantaneous mixtures of independent signals
aliases: underdetermined instantaneous mixtures of independent signals
Entity-underdetermined_instantaneous_mix.description: A mixture of multiple audio signals, where each signal is not necessarily identical and independent in every time epoch, but rather has varying variances across different epochs.

mentions.local_name: underdetermined instantaneous mixtures of independent signals

Entity-first-order_autoregressive_model.label: first-order autoregressive model
Entity-first-order_autoregressive_model.description: A statistical model that assumes the current value of a signal is determined by its previous value, with only one lag in the relationship.

Entity-nonstationarity_of_the_original_s.label: nonstationarity of the original signals
Entity-nonstationarity_of_the_original_s.description: The inherent variability or lack of consistency in the characteristics, patterns, or behavior of the original audio signals.

Entity-each_epoch.label: each epoch
Entity-each_epoch.description: A period of time characterized by varying signal variances and non-independent signals that can be modeled using a first-order autoregressive process.

Entity-cramr-rao_lower_bound.label: Cramér-Rao lower bound
Entity-cramr-rao_lower_bound.description: A theoretical statistical limit that represents the minimum variance of an estimator, used to quantify the precision of parameter estimation in various statistical models.

Entity-piecewise_stationary_with_varying.label: piecewise stationary with varying variances in different epochs
aliases: piecewise stationary with varying variances in different epochs
Entity-piecewise_stationary_with_varying.description: A property of signals where they exhibit stationarity within specific time intervals (epochs) but have changing variance across these epochs.

mentions.local_name: piecewise stationary with varying variances in different epochs

Entity-nonstationarity.label: nonstationarity
Entity-nonstationarity.description: A property or characteristic that refers to the lack of statistical constancy in a signal, process, or system over time.

Entity-natural_speech_signal.label: natural speech signals
Entity-natural_speech_signal.description: Audio data or patterns that occur naturally during human communication, such as spoken language.

Entity-signal.label: signals
Entity-signal.description: A sequence or pattern of information, such as audio data, that conveys meaning or can be processed to extract useful insights.

Entity-problem.label: problem
Entity-problem.description: A challenging or unresolved issue that requires investigation, analysis, and potential solution.

Entity-model.label: model
Entity-model.description: A mathematical algorithm or technique used to solve a specific problem or achieve a particular goal.

Entity-method.label: method
Entity-method.description: A technique or approach used to solve a problem, often involving an algorithmic process.

Entity-state-of-the-art_method.label: state-of-the-art methods
Entity-state-of-the-art_method.description: The most advanced and effective methodologies or approaches currently available in a particular field.

Entity-this_model.label: This model
Entity-this_model.description: A research or theoretical framework, conceptually representing a set of ideas or principles

Entity-epoch.label: epochs
Entity-epoch.description: A sequence of equal periods or intervals, often used as a unit of time measurement.

Entity-previous_work.label: previous works
Entity-previous_work.description: A collection of research studies or papers that have been published previously.

Entity-paper.label: paper
Entity-paper.description: A written work presenting research or analysis on a specific topic

summary: The problem of blind separation of underdetermined instantaneous mixtures of independent signals is addressed through a method relying on nonstationarity of the original signals . The signals are assumed to be piecewise stationary with varying variances in different epochs . In comparison with previous works , in this paper it is assumed that the signals are not i.i.d. in each epoch , but obey a first-order autoregressive model . This model was shown to be more appropriate for blind separation of natural speech signals . A separation method is proposed that is nearly statistically efficient -LRB- approaching the corresponding Cramér-Rao lower bound -RRB- , if the separated signals obey the assumed model . In the case of natural speech signals , the method is shown to have separation accuracy better than the state-of-the-art methods .

Predicate-is_addressed_through_a_method_.label: is addressed through a method relying on
Predicate-is_addressed_through_a_method_.description: This predicate indicates that the subject's issue or challenge (problem) is resolved or tackled by utilizing a specific approach or technique that relies on the object, which can be an underlying principle, concept, property, or characteristic. The connection between the subject and object suggests that the method or strategy employed to address the problem has its foundation in the object.

Predicate-of.label: of
Predicate-of.description: The predicate 'of' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject has some inherent or defining characteristic that is described by the object. The object typically provides more information about what makes up, composes, or characterizes the subject.

Predicate-are_assumed_to_be.label: are assumed to be
Predicate-are_assumed_to_be.description: The predicate 'are assumed to be' indicates a hypothetical or inferred relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that based on available information, data, or analysis, it can be reasonably concluded that the subject has the described characteristics or properties specified by the object.

Predicate-compared_with.label: compared with
Predicate-compared_with.description: The predicate 'compared with' indicates a relationship of similarity or contrast between two entities (subject and object), suggesting that one entity (the subject) shares characteristics, features, or qualities with another entity (the object).

Predicate-obey.label: obey
Predicate-obey.description: The predicate 'obey' indicates a relationship of compliance or adherence between the subject and object, suggesting that the subject follows or conforms to the rules, principles, or guidelines specified by the object.

Predicate-is_shown_to_be_more_appropriat.label: is shown to be more appropriate for
Predicate-is_shown_to_be_more_appropriat.description: Indicates that a subject (typically an entity or concept) has been demonstrated or proven to have a superior suitability or fit with respect to achieving a specific goal, task, or objective represented by the object. This predicate highlights the subject's capabilities and effectiveness in addressing the challenge or problem described by the object.

Predicate-is_addressed_through.label: is addressed through
Predicate-is_addressed_through.description: This predicate indicates that a solution or approach (object) is used to tackle or resolve an issue or challenge (subject). The object provides a means of addressing, handling, or overcoming the subject. In general, it describes how something is dealt with or managed.

Predicate-proposes.label: proposes
Predicate-proposes.description: To propose means to suggest or recommend something, typically as a solution or approach. The predicate 'proposes' indicates that the subject (in this case, an entity such as a method) suggests or recommends the object (which can be any type of idea, concept, plan, etc.) for consideration or implementation.

Predicate-address.label: address
Predicate-address.description: To 'address' means to direct one's attention or response towards something, typically a written work such as an article, report, or paper. This predicate indicates that the subject has focused its consideration on the object, often providing a solution, explanation, or commentary.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or example of a more general concept or category represented by the object. The relationship between the subject and object is one of instantiation, where the subject is a particular case or manifestation of the broader term.
